property.name: mapreduce.framework.name
property.description: The runtime framework for executing MapReduce jobs. Can be one of local, classic or yarn.
If enabled, user can submit an application cross-platform i.e. submit an application from a Windows client to a Linux/Unix server or vice versa.
property.name: mapreduce.app-submission.cross-platform
mapreduce.map.log.level
property.description: The logging level for the map task. The allowed levels are: OFF, FATAL, ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG, TRACE and ALL. The setting here could be overridden if "mapreduce.job.log4j-properties-file" is set.

property.name: mapreduce.reduce.log.level
property.description: The logging level for the reduce task. The allowed levels are: OFF, FATAL, ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG, TRACE and ALL. The setting here could be overridden if "mapreduce.job.log4j-properties-file" is set.

property.name: mapreduce.jobtracker.jobhistory.location
property.description: If job tracker is static the history files are stored in this single well known place. If No value is set here, by default, it is in the local file system at ${hadoop.log.dir}/history.

property.name: mapreduce.job.log4j-properties-file
property.description: Used to override the default settings of log4j in container-log4j.properties for NodeManager. Like container-log4j.properties, it requires certain framework appenders properly defined in this overriden file. The file on the path will be added to distributed cache and classpath. If no-scheme is given in the path, it defaults to point to a log4j file on the local FS.

property.name: mapreduce.jobhistory.webapp.address
property.description: MapReduce JobHistory Server Web UI host:port
